intro: Magnolia denudata var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple magnolia, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its large, showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves appear. The leaves are broad, ovate, and have a smooth texture, turning yellow in the fall. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and parks.
